title: STRchive-Loci
citation_format: In text: [@pmid:20560987; @pmid:26220009], individual citations in a list: [pmid:20560987, pmid:26220009]

chrom.title: Chrom
chrom.description: Chromosome name, assumed to be the same for all reference genomes

start_hg38.title: Start hg38
start_hg38.description: Start position in hg38 reference genome. Coordinates are BED style: 0-based, half-open.

stop_hg38.title: Stop hg38
stop_hg38.description: Stop position in hg38 reference genome. Coordinates are BED style: 0-based, half-open.

start_hg19.title: Start hg19
start_hg19.description: Start position in hg19 reference genome. Coordinates are BED style: 0-based, half-open.

stop_hg19.title: Stop hg19
stop_hg19.description: Stop position in hg19 reference genome. Coordinates are BED style: 0-based, half-open.

start_t2t.title: Start t2t
start_t2t.description: Start position in chm13-T2T reference genome. Coordinates are BED style: 0-based, half-open.

stop_t2t.title: Stop t2t
stop_t2t.description: Stop position in chm13-T2T reference genome. Coordinates are BED style: 0-based, half-open.

id.title: ID
id.description: Unique identifier for the locus within STRchive in the form [disease_id]_[gene] e.g. CANVAS_RFC1. Additional characters may be added to the end of the ID to make it unique within STRchive, e.g. HFG_HOXA13-I, HFG_HOXA13-II

gene_strand.title: Gene Strand
gene_strand.description: Direction of gene transcription relative to reference genome e.g. + or -

reference_motif_reference_orientation.title: Ref. Motif Ref. Orient.
reference_motif_reference_orientation.description: Motif in the reference genome in the + reference orientation (regardless of if it is pathogenic) e.g. AAAAG

pathogenic_motif_reference_orientation.title: Path. Motif Ref. Orient.
pathogenic_motif_reference_orientation.description: Pathogenic motif(s) in the + reference orientation e.g. AAGGG,ACAGG

pathogenic_motif_gene_orientation.title: Path. Motif Gene Orient.
pathogenic_motif_gene_orientation.description: Pathogenic motif(s) in the gene orientation, so the reverse complement if gene is on - strand e.g. CCCTT,CCTGT

benign_motif_reference_orientation.title: Ben. Motif Ref. Orient.
benign_motif_reference_orientation.description: Pathogenic motif(s) in the + reference orientation e.g. AAAAG

disease.title: Disease
disease.description: Disease name in words e.g. Cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy, and vestibular areflexia syndrome

locus_structure.title: Locus Structure
locus_structure.description: Structure of the locus including the order of motifs and any interruptions. The main_repeat will typically have a count of null. Only one motif can have a null count.

inheritance.title: Inheritance
inheritance.description: Inheritance pattern(s) of the disease e.g. AD for autosomal dominant

location_in_gene.title: Location In Gene
location_in_gene.description: Location of the repeat locus in the gene e.g. Intron 2

benign_min.title: Benign Min
benign_min.description: Minimum number of repeats in the benign (normal) range

benign_max.title: Benign Max
benign_max.description: Maximum number of repeats in the benign (normal) range. Must be >= benign_min

intermediate_min.title: Intermediate Min
intermediate_min.description: Minimum number of repeats in the intermediate range

intermediate_max.title: Intermediate Max
intermediate_max.description: Maximum number of repeats in the intermediate range. Must be >= intermediate_min

pathogenic_min.title: Pathogenic Min
pathogenic_min.description: Minimum number of repeats in the pathogenic range

pathogenic_max.title: Pathogenic Max
pathogenic_max.description: Maximum number of repeats in the pathogenic range. Must be >= pathogenic_min

ref_copies.title: Ref Copies
ref_copies.description: Number of motif copies in the reference genome

motif_len.title: Motif Len
motif_len.description: Length of the motif in base pairs

age_onset.title: Age Onset
age_onset.description: Description of the age of onset of the disease with citations

age_onset_min.title: Age Onset Min
age_onset_min.description: Minimum age of onset reported in the literatre (years)

age_onset_max.title: Age Onset Max
age_onset_max.description: Maximum age of onset reported in the literatre (years). Must be >= age_onset_min

typ_age_onset_min.title: Typ. Age Onset Min
typ_age_onset_min.description: Minimum of the typical age of onset range reported in the literatre (years)

typ_age_onset_max.title: Typ. Age Onset Max
typ_age_onset_max.description: Maximum of the typical age of onset range reported in the literatre (years). Must be >= typ_age_onset_min

novel.title: Novel
novel.description: If the pathogenic motif is in the reference genome, ref, otherwise, novel

mechanism.title: Mechanism
mechanism.description: Brief/categorical mechanism of disease e.g. LoF

mechanism_detail.title: Mechanism Detail
mechanism_detail.description: Detailed mechanism of disease with citations e.g. Loss of function [@pmid:38467784]

source.title: Source
source.description: Source of the data. NOTE: this field may be removed in the future

details.title: Details
details.description: Detailed information about the repeat locus and evidence for pathogenicity, with citations in the format [@pmid:38467784]. This could include information about motifs, interruptions, and other features of the repeat.

prevalence.title: Prevalence
prevalence.description: Prevalence of the disease as a fraction

prevalence_details.title: Prevalence Details
prevalence_details.description: Details about the prevalence of the disease including affected populations and citations in the format [@pmid:38467784]

stripy.title: STRIpy
stripy.description: STRIpy ID(s) for the disease, typically the gene ID

gnomad.title: gnomAD
gnomad.description: gnomAD ID(s) for the gene, typically the gene ID

year.title: Year
year.description: Year of first publication of the tandem repeat disease locus with citations

webstr_hg38.title: WebSTR hg38
webstr_hg38.description: WebSTR ID(s) for the locus in hg38

webstr_hg19.title: WebSTR hg19
webstr_hg19.description: WebSTR ID(s) for the locus in hg19

tr_atlas.title: TRatlas
tr_atlas.description: Tandem Repeat Atlas ID(s) for the locus

disease_description.title: Disease Description
disease_description.description: Description of the disease with citations
examples: Sensory disturbances, imbalance, oscillopsia, chronic dry cough, dysarthria and dysphagia [@pmid:38876750]

locus_tags.title: Locus Tags
locus_tags.description: Tags for the locus, used for grouping similar loci and for flagging loci with specific characteristics. Should be snake_case (lower case with underscores) and not contain spaces or special characters. Some tags have specific meanings, such as sparse_evidence for loci with < 5 independent cases after 5 years of publication, or conflicting_evidence for loci where there is evidence for and against pathogenicity in the literature resulting in concern that the locus may not be pathogenic.

disease_tags.title: Disease Tags
disease_tags.description: Tags for the disease, used for grouping similar diseases and for flagging diseases with specific characteristics. Should be snake_case (lower case with underscores) and not contain spaces or special characters.

references.title: References
references.description: All references from the fields above. Automatically generated from all in-text citations.

additional_literature.title: Additional Literature
additional_literature.description: Additional literature related to this locus in the format. Should not be included in the references field. Automatically generated from scripts that search the literature.
